question: Which Indian CM pledges to serve the farmers on priority under APART project.
explanation: Enveloping Assam's 'agri-business' by focusing on farmers income, Chief Minister Sarbananda Sonowal directed to make farmers interests a priority. He advocated priority outlining and creation of adequate amenities for the farmers under the Assam Agri-business and Rural Transformation Project (APART). Reviewing APART, an agriculture department project, in a meeting in Guwahati, CM Sonowal asked the implementing agency to take into account the interests and priorities of the farmers.
